intro: Schizodium modestum, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is known for its milky sap, which is typical of the Apocynaceae family. Schizodium modestum thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It is a relatively uncommon species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
